meanings.definition: To make small movements, especially of the hands and feet, through nervousness or impatience.
meanings.sent1: She fidged in her seat while waiting for the test results.
meanings.sent2: The child fidged with excitement before opening the birthday present.
meanings.sent3: During the meeting, he fidged so much that his pen fell off the table.
meanings.sent4: The squirrel fidged with its acorn, trying to crack it open.
meanings.sent5: The student fidged with his pencil, tapping it on the desk rhythmically.

meanings.sent1: The cat fidged around the room, unable to settle down.
meanings.sent2: He fidged in his chair, unable to focus on the lecture.
meanings.sent3: The dog fidged with excitement when it saw its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The leaves fidged in the wind, creating a soothing rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: She fidged with her necklace, twisting it around her fingers absentmindedly.
